actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Mr. King (NY) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1511.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
actions.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: To award a congressional gold medal to Prime Minister Tony Blair.
popular_title: Gold Medal to Tony Blair bill

summary.text: Directs the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President Pro Tempore of the Senate to arrange for the presentation, on behalf of Congress, of a gold medal to Prime Minister Tony Blair of the United Kingdom in recognition of his outstanding and enduring contributions to maintaining the security of all freedom-loving nations. Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to: (1) strike such gold medal (and authorizes the Secretary to strike and sell duplicate bronze medals); and (2) deposit sums received from the sale of the bronze medals into the U.S. Mint Public Enterprise Fund.

titles.title: Gold Medal to Tony Blair bill
To award a congressional gold medal to Prime Minister Tony Blair.
